Some General Q's
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Card & Adventure Video Games: Monster Rancher Battlecard Episode II Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Some General Q's
By lovesaurian on Saturday, August 5, 2000 - 12:00 pm:

I was just wondering how many monsters there are, and are there rares like there are in MR1 and 2? How do you get monsters? What's this game about anyway?

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, August 5, 2000 - 12:03 pm:

Try Reading the only thread in the FAQ section to find out what it's about. There are 20 main types of monster cards (check out the CD list for a list of types), no one has found subs yet. There are no rare ??? monster cards.

By Tony on Saturday, August 5, 2000 - 12:51 pm:

I'm beginning to wonder if maybe the subs can be acquired at Hard level only? Who knows...

By John Hawley on Saturday, August 5, 2000 - 02:47 pm:

Has any one tried the Breeders Cup yet? Based on the Pride card, I would say that mixed breeds unlock through winning the Breeders Cup.

By Trickster on Saturday, August 5, 2000 - 08:23 pm:

Actually, I have tried the Breeders Cup (I think... it was a "D" level tournament")... I'm pretty sure I won it, and while I haven't acquired any mixed breed cards yet, I did notice that suddenly Leon started throwing mixed breeds into his deck (a hare hound and a suezo mask).

Oh, and to go along with the theory on main/sub for the mixed breeds allowing attack/defense, I also noticed that he was using hare cards for defense for the hare hound, and tiger cards for the attack, and was attacking with gali cards for the suezo mask (I don't think he had the chance come up to defend with it).

By John Hawley on Sunday, August 6, 2000 - 09:42 am:

Sure, the manual says that mixed breeds will use the main breed attacks and the sub breed defenses. Must make for an interesting looking deck ; p

By Farmer Jimbo on Monday, August 7, 2000 - 07:24 am:

The breeders cup just give's you a bunch of skill cards. No monster cards.

Sub breeds seem to availible in the A class tourneys. You may have to aquire all the monster cards first though (according to Fade).
